description: A passive infrared (PIR) motion sensor module based on the LHI778 probe design. It offers high sensitivity, low power consumption, and a wide operating voltage range (4.5–20 V). The module features adjustable delay and block times, dual‑probe detection, and a 3.3 V TTL output.
application_examples: Automatic lighting control (floor, bathroom, basement, porch, warehouse, garage)

other: Delay time adjustable 0.3 s to 5 min
Dual‑probe rectangular window for increased sensitivity

getting_started.connection_guide: Connect VCC to the supply voltage (4.5–20 V DC), GND to ground, and Data to a microcontroller input pin. Ensure the input can tolerate 3.3 V logic levels.

example_code.explaination: This simple Arduino sketch reads the PIR sensor output and prints a message to the serial monitor whenever motion is detected.
